Leggings are a type of skin-tight garment that covers the legs and may be worn by both men and women.
Leggings are a type of skin-tight clothing that cover the legs and may be worn by both men and women.
The word legging can refer to the leg of a garment, i.e. the part of a trouser leg that covers the leg.
A woman is wearing black leggings.

Leggings are a type of skin-tight garment that covers the legs and may be worn by both men and women. Originally, leggings were two separate garments, one for each leg. Modern leggings are typically made from a blend of lycra (also known as spandex or elastane) and cotton.
Pants are a garment worn over the hips and legs, covering both the legs separately.
Pants are a garment worn from the waist to the ankles, covering both legs separately (rather than with cloth extending across both legs as in robes, skirts, and dresses).
The woman is wearing black leggings.
Pants, leggings, trousers, slacks, jeans, chaps, breeks, and trews.
Jeans are trousers, a type of garment, typically made from denim or dungaree cloth.
